intro: Trithuria brevistyla, commonly known as the narrow-styled trithuria, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is closely related to the grass family. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Trithuria brevistyla is characterized by its short, sturdy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves.
